alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Northern St. Tammany; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN ST. TAMMANY, EAST CENTRAL TANGIPAHOA AND WESTERN WASHINGTON PARISHES THROUGH 345 PM CDT... At 314 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Enon, or 7 miles southeast of Franklinton, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Covington, Franklinton, Abita Springs, Folsom, Sun, and Enon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; Northern St. Tammany; Washington
